data.title: Large Park designed for sports
data.text: I remember playing sports at this park; baseball, softball, volleyball, basketball, tennis - playing with my children, riding bikes all over, getting food at the snack shack at ball games and enjoying large bbq's and potlucks with groups and friends. Plenty of shades. There is a dedicated DOG PARK area - separate from the general public.

data.title: A park for every purpose
data.text: Camino Real is my neighborhood park, and a fine one it is.  It boasts facilities for tennis, baseball, soccer, and a off-leash dog park.  It's eucalyptus groves harbor Monarch butterflies during their migration season, The paths are well maintained and great for dog walking.  Parking is ample, and picnic facilities are scattered through the park.  We're really lucky to have this place in our neighborhood.

data.title: butterflies and baseball
data.text: This large grassy park is full of shady eucalyptus trees which from September to March shelter monarch butterflies. The best time to see them is in October and November; go in the morning and as the sun hits the trees and warms the air, the sky will fill with their colorful flights. In spring, the park is full of baseball --it hosts the Coastal Little League. The park is more for sports than picnic, but there is a small, sunny playground area.

data.title: PARK
data.text: Great park lots of trees 3 play grounds baseball basketball tennis big fields of grass monarch butterflies roost there in cool months

data.title: oasis in the city
data.text: great park for little ones! played catch w/my 8-year old and running after the ball with my almost 2-year old. we brought a picnic lunch, ran on the grass, played in two of the playground equipment areas, used the restroom. just a few other people around with kids, with dogs, taking a walk. lovely, leisurely, clean park.
